creator: clm@csse.monash.edu.au
text:
[Perhaps this belongs more in Bridge.]

If a rect has a width or height of 0, the 1.1 spec says that rendering should be
disabled for this element.  But if the width and height attributes are
subsequently changed to non zero values by script, the rect never gets rendered.

creator: deweese@apache.org
text: This is fixed in current CVS (post 1.5b5).
